description: Implement cairn use command to switch between multiple issue files. 'cairn use' shows current and lists available files, 'cairn use <name>' switches to specified file. Store active file in .cairn/config.json

acceptance_criteria.text: CLI command 'cairn use' without arguments lists all available issue files and shows current active file with * marker
CLI command 'cairn use <name>' switches to specified issue file and creates it if it doesn't exist

Core library createContainer accepts optional issuesFileName parameter with default 'issues.jsonl'
VS Code extension reads and respects active file from config
Init command creates default config.json with 'default' as active file

title: Add config file watcher to VS Code extension
description: Watch .cairn/config.json for changes and automatically reload services when active file changes. Show notification to user when switch occurs.

acceptance_criteria.text: File watcher monitors .cairn/config.json for changes
Services automatically reinitialize when config changes
User receives notification showing which file was switched to
Watcher is properly disposed when extension deactivates
Error handling for failed reloads with user notification

comments.author: agent
comments.content: Added file watcher using fs.watch() to monitor .cairn/config.json. When config changes, services are automatically reinitialized with new issue file and user gets notification. Watcher is properly disposed on extension deactivation. Error handling included with user-facing error messages.

title: Add file selector and smart context switching to VS Code extension
description: Add issue file selector dropdown, config file watcher with notifications on external changes, and hot-swap services without disrupting user. Show status bar with current file, notify on CLI changes with action button to switch.

acceptance_criteria.text: Status bar shows current active file with format 'Cairn: {filename}'
Command palette has 'Cairn: Switch Issue File' command to select from available files
Quick pick shows current file with checkmark, file descriptions, and option to create new file
Config file watcher detects external changes from CLI 'cairn use' commands
When config changes externally, show notification with 'Switch Now' and 'Stay Here' buttons
Services hot-swap without window reload when switching files
User-initiated changes via extension don't trigger unnecessary notifications
